description: With the people finally throwing away the shackles of their foreign oppressors, now is the time for the Nationalist Party to come to the forefront as the confrontation they had been preparing for nearly a decade ensues. We will prevail, by any means necessary!

name: The Second Grito de Lares
description: With our foreign oppressors now coming back to put their shackles back on us, we need to rally our people once more. The most well known rebellion on our island was the 1868 Grito de Lares, and in order to rally our people, we should embrace the idea that this is the Second Grito de Lares, the one where Puerto Rico will finally be free!

name: Form Popular Militias
description: There's no time to wait for Esteves' National Guard to mobilise. We need every man we can get and as such, we should start mobilising every man and woman that wishes to see Puerto Rico be independent from foreign invaders.

name: The Revolution Successful
description: One way or another, our new government has survived against all odds. Now, we need to look forward to rebuilding and remaking Puerto Rico from scratch.

name: Refit Castle San Felipe del Morro
description: Castle San Felipe del Morro has long stood as one of the major defensive fortification of the island. While vastly outdated, there are ways we can improvise its construction and strategical position to turn it into a fortification that can effectively defend San Juan from foreign invaders.

name: Naval Invasion Defences
description: The refitting of the castle is not enough to secure the entire island. We require trenches, bunkers, sea walls, anything and everything that may help us repel or at the very least slow down the invaders.

name: Weapons Smuggling
description: Given our lack of local industry, we have no option but to secure weapons through 'unconventional' means. Some Cuban smugglers have contacted us to sneak rifles into our island, but they'll obviously not do this for free...

name: Recruitment Efforts
description: The militias we raised are important, but not quite enough. We need every hand on deck for the coming battles, and we should try and encourage the recruitment of every able bodied men from the island to at least auxiliary roles.

name: Guerrilla Warfare Tactics
description: The Cadets of the Republic have long since taken up arms in the forests and jungles of the island, preparing for the time they'd need to fight the Americans. Now, their expertise is direly needed for our struggle, and thankfully, they have a thing or two to teach to our new recruits.

name: Improvised Anti Air Batteries
description: While we may control the land on our island, the enemy has certain control of the skies. We need to create a division in our militias that keeps watch of the skies and dedicates itself to taking down enemy planes as they appear. We may not have much, but perhaps we can re-purpose some of the machine guns the Americans left behind for this task.

name: For a Free Puerto Rico!
description: With our defences ready, our army prepared and the enemies at our gates, it should be every citizen's duty to make sure we succeed. Sacrifices may have to be made, rationing will have to be done, but victory wasn't meant to be easy. Regardless, we need to march forward if we wish to save our nation from another century of colonialism, onwards!

name: Fate of the Democrats
description: While democratic parties like the Liberals were supportive of our revolt, others like the Republicans or Socialists were opposed to our revolution. Luckily, we don't need to deal with their attempts at weakening our government any further, so it shall be up to our leader to decide whether or not we should keep a façade of legitimacy by supporting these parties, or if we should just cut them off for good.

name: The New Puerto Rican Government
description: With Albizu now comfortably sitting in La Fortaleza, the Nationalist Party of Puerto Rico must convene to decide on the new government. However, all may not be as good as it looks, and cracks are beginning to form within the party...

name: Towards a New Puerto Rico
description: Albizu has grand plans to remaking Puerto Rico from the ground up. Now that we have fully released ourselves from the shackles of European and American Imperialism, there's no better time than to start remaking our society, from its political sphere, to its economic sphere as well as its social sphere. A series of reforms will begin soon enough that will shape the fate of our nation for the years to come!

name: Deal with the Remaining Americans
description: Americans have long been a plague in the island and we're finally in a position to deliver a killing blow to their presence here for good. However, not everyone agrees that we should do this in the party, and it falls to Albizu to resolve this disagreement...

name: Economic Reform Program
description: Despite years of attempted economic reform, none of the American policies managed to truly help the common Puerto Rican. As such, it falls to the Nationalist party to ensure a better livelihood for all Puerto Ricans, but as for what that entails, it remains to be discussed by the party...

name: Political Reform Campaign
description: For decades, Puerto Ricans have existed isolated from political activity. It was only during very short and very restricted periods where our people actually enjoyed the right of voting, and this has all been due to the permeating influence of foreign oppressors. Luckily, the Nationalist Party may yet have a cure for such a disease...

name: Social Reform Plan
description: While our culture has endured despite attempts of cultural colonisation by the Americans, there is still work to be done towards consolidating it. As such, the party has drafted a plan to solidify some of the concepts Albizu has denominated as 'Puerto Rican', but it'll be up to him whether he truly wants his concept of Puerto Rican identity to be mandatory or only something for true Patriots...

name: International Recognition
description: With our revolt having been less than legal, and highly violent, the international community originally shunned us and refused to acknowledge our existence, largely to toe the line to their Anglo-Saxon masters! However, a long time has passed since then, and it may now be time to finally reach out with the rest of the world in a search for recognition.

name: The Antillean Dream
description: The idea of a United Antillean state was proposed by one of Puerto Rico's founding fathers, Ramón Emeterio Betances. Considering that such a union would also afford us protection from further aggression, it could be a positive geopolitical move, especially now that there are no Spaniards or Americans to defend us.

name: A Truly Independent Puerto Rico
description: We need no rulers or masters to guide our path. Puerto Rico is perfectly fine as its own thing in the Caribbean, and our only search should be for someone who wishes us to remain this way, as opposed to trying to secure any long dead dream of grandeur our founding fathers may have had.

name: Economic Integration
description: One of the big obstacles to an Antillean union is the heterogeneous nature of the Cuban, Dominican and Puerto Rican economy. This will require a multinational cooperation effort, but it will ease up the unification process once it is complete.

name: Political Integration
description: Another of the big obstacles to the Antillean union is the large, almost irreconcilable differences regarding to the internal workings of the politics on each of its members. We will have to unify the offices and ministries of a lot of sectors if we wish to reach a cohesive unit of a government as the alternative would be an ineffective government that'd very much have people desire we never unified in the first place.

name: Antilles United Once More
description: After a long road of negotiations, integrations and reforms, the time is finally right to found the Antillean Union. Long live our friends in Cuba and the Dominican Republic! May the dream of Ramón Emeterio Betances live for as long as our nations stand tall!

name: Seek a New Protector
description: Puerto Rico has always counted with a larger nation to protect it from outside aggression. First it was Spain, then it was the Americans, but now, with both fully gone from the island, we need to find a new protector.

name: Old Friendships
description: The Venezuelan government and people had been receptive of Albizu's speeches and campaigns since the start. Given their proximity and their relative power projection, perhaps it would be wise to close ties with them once more, and take advantage of our diplomatic affinity for our protection.

name: Constitutional Convention
description: Our first move as an independent nation should be to draft a constitution. While not every nation has or needs a constitution, it'll help solidify the legitimacy of our government over the people of Puerto Rico in the eyes of the international community, as well as allowing us to establish a set of baseline rules all parties have to follow from now on.

name: First Election of Puerto Rico
description: Discounting the Legislative elections that were held every four years after the Jones Act, now is the first time in decades that the Puerto Rican people have been able to vote on their representatives. While excitement over this historical event is nearly palpable, there are still worries abroad that a radical party being elected can potentially throw the careful co-existence of parties in the island off course...

name: International Recognition
description: While our declaration of Independence having been a rather peaceful affair has solidified our position in the international stage, we still need to re-establish formal relations with countries that could and should recognise us as a sovereign nation. As such, we should dispatch delegates as soon as possible to negotiate with other nations in order to establish new embassies abroad.

name: Partido Union Elected
description: The Partido Union, founded in 1932 by Jose Cull y Cuchi after deserting from the nationalist party, is an oddity of the Puerto Rican political scene. While strictly a protectionist party, similar to the PNPR, it has picked up some of the rhetoric of the America First Party, to the point its leader is openly compared to Huey Long! and as the election seems to suggest, maybe that's just what Puerto Rico wants right now...

name: Partido Nacionalista Victorious
description: While not an underdog by any stretch, the Nationalist victory still comes as a surprise for many who saw the party as a temporal entity, one that was meant to exist to seek a violent independence from foreigners as opposed to one running a democratically elected office. Nevertheless, Albizu has clearly come ahead in the voting booths, and shall now be President of Puerto Rico.

name: Partido Liberal Successful
description: With [ROOT.GetLeader] now as the acting president, many expect that the Puerto Rican instability that has disrupted the island for nearly a decade will finally come to an end, as the Liberals had promised. Whether they'll be able to deliver or not, however, remains to be seen...

name: Partido Socialista Triumphant
description: An underdog in the election, the Partido Socialista has managed to win against all odds. Now, it falls to ageing Santiago Iglesias Pantín to lead Puerto Rico for the next four years, and hopefully bring a semblance of stability and progress that has for so long eluded the island.

name: Operación Serenidad
description: One of the main issues that the President has stated from the Puerto Rican society is that culturally, it's not yet prepared to embrace a modern industrial lifestyle. To fix this, he has proposed a bill that has come to be known by the press as Operación Serenidad, with the intent of passing an education reform where the government will enshrine industrial values and respect for other market-oriented nations.

name: Land Reform
description: With long-time dominance by Spanish and American colonialism, the land of Puerto Rico has been generally dominated by the sugar industry. In order to fix this, we must begin to redistribute the land from big sugar to the people of Puerto Rico. We will no longer be simply, as the Americans have described us, "a mountain range entirely surrounded by sugar cane", but a country of the people.

name: Nationalist Reform Program
description: While the Nationalists have managed to be elected, they have done so with a minority of the votes, forcing it to ally with the Union Party. This means that, while the Nationalists have brought an extremely ambitious reform program to the table, it's likely that it'll come out on the other side in a very different version that what they had originally intended to pass...

name: Share the Wealth
description: The Union Party has been built to closely resemble the America First Party in the United States, and as such, has picked up on the Share the Wealth Program and its intricacies. Now, the President has proposed a bill in the Puerto Rican Congress so that the dream of a Puerto Rican share the wealth program actually becomes a reality. Whether this plan will be a success or utter failure, remains to be seen...

name: Anti-American Sentiment
description: Despite the Americans fully abandoning the island legally speaking by now, there is no denying that many within our people are more than resentful to them. We can channel that resentment to push forward legislation that'd be otherwise considered controversial, and hopefully be able to expropriate American landowners in favour of Puerto Rican ones without having too much political backlash.

name: Solidify Belief in Democracy
description: Puerto Rico had started to lose faith in democracy when the 1932 legislative election yielded the victory of Pro-American parties, with significant groups of the Puerto Rican electorate outright refusing to vote from there on. With our independence, this apathy to our system of governance should not be allowed, and we should start a nation wide propaganda campaign to spread the benefits of democracy to the people.

name: Shining Jewel of the Caribbean
description: As our government's reforms are completed and we march forward, there's a sense of national unity and progress that had left the island since the Spanish-American War. For the first time, Puerto Ricans can now participate openly in politics, and choose their own destiny, and that is slowly turning our small island into a shining beacon of peace and stability for our neighbours to see.

name: The Puerto Rican Fair Deal
description: Having seen first hand the policies the Republicans have proposed in America, the Liberal leadership has had plans of passing a similar program in the island. Now, with their election into power, it's time for this idea to leave the drawing board and finally reach congress, and later, the Puerto Rican people.

name: Puerto Rican Autarky
description: The Union Party has proposed a slightly less aggressive plan of autarky than the Nationalists. While sugar exporters rejoice, there's no denying that tough times are coming until we can fully industrialise the island, but Jose Coll y Cuchi has stated that this will be a small sacrifice today for the rewards we will get tomorrow.

name: Direct Economic Control
description: The PNPR has argued that our government should take full control of Economic Exports in our nation, and with the support of the Union party, it seems likely that they'll get their way. While cash crop producers bemoan the bill introduced by Albizu, others point out, perhaps rightly, that this can possibly change the island for the better.

name: Labour Friendly Laws
description: The labour movement in Puerto Rico is small, but not negligible. The Liberal party has long since tried to reach agreements with them but so far, they had chosen to toe the line to the Americans in exchange for investments. Now, however, with us in power, we can offer them new agreements and mediate some labour disputes in their favour to further solidify our position as Puerto Rico's most popular party.

name: Operación Manos a La Obra
description: The island's greatest woe is its lack of industrialisation, which has left a great part of our population unemployed. However, there's still hope for us. The President has come into congress with an extremely ambitious plan, dubbed by the press as Operation Manos a la Obra. In it, he intends to push our economy to the limit in order to reach a new standard of industrialisation.

name: Chengdu-Chongqing Railway
description: Most of Sichuan still relies on the same dirt trails that have been in use since the early Imperial era. We can't have a modern economy without modern infrastructure. By connecting our most vital cities with a modern railway line we'll create the foundation for Sichuan's new industries.

name: New Commercial Zones
description: The state alone cannot bring prosperity to its people. By designating certain parts of Sichuan as special commercial zones with attractive prices, we'll be able to attract investments from other parts of China as well as abroad.

name: The Yangtze Lifeline
description: Being a landlocked country, we conduct most of our trade along the Yangtze River and rely on merchant vessels to reach the rest of China and beyond. By partnering with a reliable manufacturer, we can make sure that we have enough ships to expand our trade along the river.

name: Restart the Agricultural Sector
description: Our agriculture was hit hardest in the civil war and the subsequent drought which has left it a shadow of its former self. A major program of repairs to the Dujiangyan systems and farm reconstruction is needed if we're going to recover. It'll be the first step on the road to turning the Sichuan basin into the bread basket of China.

name: Rural Construction College
description: The heavy focus on our industrial heartland has left the rural regions behind with many countryside communities looking like they did in the dynasties of old. With so much untapped potential, it'd be a waste not to bring in the wonders of modern engineering to improve the lives - and productivity - of our farmers.

name: Rice and Wheat Improvement Station
description: Outdated farming techniques causes us a significant amount of wasted output across our agricultural sector. Modernising how we process our crops will greatly improve both the yields and the quality of what our farms produce annually, which should go a long way in preventing any future shortages.

name: Expand the Dujiangyan Irrigation System
description: Repairing Dujiangyan sufficed at first, but with our increased output and wealth it's high time we modernised and expanded it. With the skill and knowledge provided by the Rural Construction College, we'll turn these ancient channels once again into the crown jewel of agriculture along the Yangtze!

name: Zigong Saltworks
description: Salt has been an important cornerstone of Sichuanese economy since ancient times. While no longer the backbone it used to be in our industrialised economy, by expanding and modernising our salt mines we'll make sure it remains a profitable venture for us in the future as well.

name: Study Production Innovations
description: It's one thing to have access to advanced machinery, but if we are to be able to match the production methods of the Europeans and Japanese with our own, we need to study their respective approaches and apply what we learn to our own manufacturing techniques. As always, the IPC has budgeted for the associated costs.

name: Import Foreign Machinery
description: With both our industrial hubs of Chongqing and Chengdu badly battered by the war, we'll need to import equipment from abroad in order to get our industry back on its feet again. The planning committee has already laid out a budget for this and they only await our approval.

name: Modern Construction Technology
description: The Industrial Planning Committee has reached the conclusion that there's no way around the fact that our construction methods, tools and even basic know-how are all outdated. By bringing in more equipment and advisers to Sichuan, we'll be able to refine our construction methods.

name: Industrial Planning Committee
description: Before we launch any major industrialisation programs we need to set up a committee to assess our available resources after the civil war and plan the best approach for our future expansions. While it'll considerably expand the bureaucratic apparatus, the increased efficiency will pay dividends in the end.

name: Tianfu Mining Bureau
description: By investing into expanding our current mining sector, we'll be able to reach more of Sichuan's riches. This will be vital not only for strengthening our economy, but will help us remain independent of foreign imports as well.

name: Industrial Silk
description: Industrialisation has seen massive improvements both for the quality and quantity of the textile industry, yet the fruits of these developments have yet to see widespread adoption in our factories and workshops. It's high time that we started to adopt industrial silk production techniques on a large scale.

name: Rebuild the Chengdu Machine Bureau
description: Underutilised before the war and damaged during it, the Chengdu Machine Bureau has great potential thanks to previous investments into its infrastructure. We'll rebuild it and make it a cornerstone of Chengdu's industrialisation process.

name: Urban Modernisation and Sanitation
description: With our industry's rapid growth and the early successes of our urbanisation program, the next step is to bring the great cities of Sichuan into the twentieth century by modernising their infrastructure to modern standards. It'll greatly improve living standards for the inhabitants and allow us to expand them further.

name: Western China Academy of Sciences
description: An important part of our modernisation plan is to make Sichuan a landmark for higher education in China. By establishing the Western China Academy of Sciences, we'll be able to better educate our citizens and attract some of the brightest minds in China to our country.

name: Jialing Coal Fields
description: Our industry is predominantly fuelled by coal. It keeps the lights on in our factories and it keeps our people warm. We must make sure that our coal production can keep pace with our demand for energy.

name: Increase Steel Production
description: Many of Sichuan's steel mills and ore mines use techniques and tools from the last century and sometimes these methods even more backwards and outdated to the point where they endanger our labourers. Bringing these methods into the current century will turn Chongqing into the beating heart of Chinese steel production.

name: Extract Natural Gas
description: Sichuan sits upon the largest natural gas reserve in China, but a lot of it remains untapped. We ought to invest in this sector so that these riches don't go to waste.

name: Modernised Manufacturing
description: Our efforts that began with the reconstruction after the civil war have blossomed and helped turn Sichuan's basin into a small, if growing, industrial heartland. We can soon boast having some of the best industrial partners in all of China and reap even more rewards from our toil and hard work.

name: Xikang Hydropower
description: For the time being, most of Sichuan's energy needs comes from the use of coal power and natural gas. Our engineers tell us, however, that there's vast amounts of untapped energy in the mountainous west, offering numerous opportunities for the construction of hydro electric dams. This should allow our energy needs to keep pace with our growing industrialisation.

name: Electrification Efforts
description: Leave the confines of Chengdu and Chongqing and much of Sichuan is lit by candles and oil at night. With our energy generation efforts bearing fruits, however, we can finally bring electricity out to the countryside. Electricity will keep the countryside bright at night, our people warm in the winter and make our factories even more productive.

name: Build the Electro-Steel Mill
description: A big part of the plan to industrialise Sichuan was to construct an Electro-Steel Mill in Chongqing. But due to the many conflicts of the past, the mill was destroyed. Now that we have the power and industrial capabilities to do so, we can materialise this powerhouse of a mill again!

name: Textile Production
description: Chinese textiles are known far and wide for their quality and unique style. Sichuan has always had a large role in this trade and with both the increased demand for these goods and the relative safety of the basin these days, it'd be a good investment to deepen our role in this trade.

name: Huaxi Machinery Factory
description: With the rapid industrialisation efforts that we have planned, the ways of old are ceding ground as we utilise more and more machine tools and vehicles. In order to keep up with demand, our planners have proposed establishing industries in the Huaxi district, turning it into a model for industrialisation.

name: The Arsenal Programme
description: Chongqing has long boasted some capable military industry, with the Chongqing Arsenal being the biggest among them. The Industrial Planning Committee has proposed an expansion of the arsenal using the techniques and equipment they've acquired, allowing us to maintain our military production edge in the region.

name: Expand Production: Artillery
description: Sichuan is home to some of the most effective small arms production in China, but there's still room for improvement when it comes to heavier ordnance. Just like the Chongqing arsenal is known across China for its effective rifles, the Heijang Artillery Arsenal will bring modern artillery production methods to Sichuan.

name: Expand Production: Tanks
description: Tanks have proven their worth in the Weltkrieg and subsequent conflicts thanks to their ability to break through enemy defences. With our growing industrial base, we're finally in a position to start small-scale production of tanks that will help us dominate the Asian battlefields.

name: Expand Production: Aircraft
description: Often neglected by Chinese military planners, aircraft are becoming an indispensable part of any modern military. Because of Sichuan's mountainous geography, catching up here could be vital for future conflicts where planes will provide eyes in the sky for our troops and artillery and rain death from above upon our enemies.

name: Rebuild the Sichuanese Army
description: The current state of Sichuan's army leaves a lot to be desired. It's an outdated and splintered body lacking in cohesion. Our first step will be to bring the army together from its fractured background so that our soldiers can fight more effectively for their homeland.

name: Rebuild the Officer Corps
description: Fractured between many different factions, it's an unfortunate fact that our army's leadership is splintered and lacks a unified sense of strategy. By establishing our own Sichuanese military academy we can start instilling a proper understanding of modern warfare into our commanders.

name: New Infantry Weapons
description: Even by the standards of the rest of China, our army lags behind in many areas. It's time we started to combat this by taking steps to modernise our infantry divisions and give our soldiers the equipment they need to defend Sichuan.

name: Import Modern Artillery
description: As it stands, many of our artillery detachment use the same guns that they fielded in the conflicts of the past decades. This won't stand. Importing foreign artillery pieces and know-how would help us a great deal in mitigating this issue.

name: Recon Unit Training
description: Most of Sichuan's terrain is harsh with high mountains and mighty rivers covering most of our lands. Knowledge of the terrain can mean the difference between life and death. Let's make sure we're on the favourable side in that equation.

name: Mountain Warfare
description: What our army may lack in modern equipment can easily be made up for by using terrain to our advantage. With most of Sichuan and her neighbours being covered in rugged mountains, a company trained to fight among them can often be worth more than a division of regular soldiers.

name: Adopt the Southern Doctrine
description: We should not blindly modernise for the sake of modernisation. Our resources make it more prudent to adopt the Southern Doctrine instead and focus on what the Europeans call unconventional tactics but fit the Chinese hand like a glove. Whether it's large-front assaults or guerrilla warfare, we'll master at it.

name: War Logistics
description: Fielding a larger army means that we have a bigger supply chain to maintain. By creating a specialised department of logistics and assigning some of our more qualified officers to oversee it, we'll ensure that our troops stay supplied while minimising corruption and waste along the way.

name: Assymetric Warfare
description: At the present it's unrealistic for us to try and match countries like Japan in terms of massed tanks, air power and artillery. Instead we should negate their advantages using our own cunning and encouraging our officers to rely of tactics that let their agile forces choose the terms of the battle, not the rigidly structured foe they face.

name: Heavy Fire Tactics
description: By training our officers and soldiers to detect weak points in the enemy's lines and quickly exploit them with overwhelming force, we can achieve breakthroughs more easily.

name: Increase Munitions Production
description: Our production of munitions need to keep pace with our increased use of heavy guns in the field. By investing into further optimising our production lines for shells and other munitions we will be able to keep up the pace and allow our front line officers to relentlessly bombard our enemies without any fears of shortages.

name: Continue the Northern Doctrine
description: What we lack in modern equipment we shall make up for by being adaptable, quick and resourceful. With speed and perseverance we will outmanoeuvre our enemies, be it through our officers cunning and initiative or our troops peerless ability to march and fight across great distances.

name: Focus on Speed
description: We'll train our troops in path-finding and invest in equipment like improved boots and tires to fine-tune our army's performance. By doing this, we're sure to dictate the terms of battle and where it's fought!

name: Improved Army Training
description: An army of untrained soldiers is hardly more effective than a mob of bandits. Although our efforts to improve the training of both our soldiers and officers have been substantial, there's still room for more refinement. We don't just want a good army - we should aim to have the most professional one in all of China.

name: Anti-Tank Preparations
description: Tall mountains, deep valleys and wide rivers. Nearly every inch of our land is a potential death trap for enemy tank crews and we'll make sure that our soldiers make the most of this fact.

name: Study Tank Designs
description: The tank has proven to be a key component in the modern battlefield. We cannot afford to lag behind in this development and must study the tank designs of Germany, France and Japan to develop our own armoured companies.

name: Irregular Tactics
description: The mountains, forests and cities have long been the only reliable allies for our armed forces. Our expertise in using asymmetrical warfare has served us well in the past and it will keep doing so in the future as well.

name: Decentralised Chain of Command
description: It's essential that our soldiers and officers act on their own initiative. While our enemy lays idle while waiting for instructions from the head of the army, our brave men will use their own heads instead!

name: Night Warfare
description: The darkness of night may blind conventional armies, but we've learned how to use it as an asset. Even an open field can be turned into an ambush spot and provide cover from enemy detection and fire. We'd be fools not to make the most of it.

name: Army of Shadows
description: We'll defeat our foes not by sacrificing our soldiers in head-on assaults, but with a thousand cuts from the shadows. Behind their lines, in their cities and even from within their ranks - there nowhere will our enemies find safety. Deception and cunning will win the day, not the foolhardy sacrifices of soldiers so many careless warlords commit.

name: Professional Legacy
description: Most of our commanders trace our military roots back to the esteemed Baoding Military Academy and many more are influenced by its teachings. We must build upon this legacy and turn Sichuan's army into a professional and disciplined military force worthy of respect.

name: Military Education Corps
description: Far too often military teachings put emphasis on the officers, with little regard for the education of the soldiers. With the right education, not only will our soldiers know how to drill and march, but they'll also have a keen eye for doctrine and its applications on a tactical level as well.

name: Well-Trained Officers
description: Many of China's modern heroes learned how to fight in the Baoding Military Academy. Carrying this legacy forward, we must make sure to do our utmost to ensure that as many of China's future heroes are trained in our academies. In producing excellent officers, even the Europeans will have to learn to respect us.

name: Army of Professionals
description: Much of China's suffering has come from warlords and corrupt officials pretending that an unruly mob can act as an army - let alone take a city without behaving like bandits in the process. We shall instead create an army of well-trained soldiers and officers, one that will fight for China with discipline and honour in equal measure.

name: Doctrinal Innovation
description: An army is only as good as its doctrine. If we don't adapt to the modern battlefield and its conditions, we'll be left in the dustbin of history. It's high time that we refine our tactics and strategies.

name: Equipment Standardisation
description: During the days of the warlords, any logistics officer would often have the unenviable burden of every local war band, governor militia and splinter force having their own rifles, ammunition and uniforms. More steps need to be taken to streamline our equipment, from the smallest manufacturing floors, all the way into the battlefield.

name: Engineer Units
description: Our home of Sichuan is a harsh landscape to fight in with its tall mountains and wide rivers. As such, specialised detachments of engineers ought to be used as much as possible to allow our forces to build the best defences and surmount the mightiest of fortifications.

name: Improved Army Drills
description: It is true that while our soldiers are disciplined and brave, our training methods sometimes leave something to be desired as our training methods haven't always kept pace with other developments. We need to refine our methods and make sure our soldiers perform to the utmost of their ability.

name: Creative Solutions
description: Sichuan and indeed most surrounding provinces are inhospitable for any army and difficult to traverse. A clever and cost-effective solution to the restrictions on mobility could be the widespread implementation of bicycle infantry, proven by the previous war in Europe to be effective even in some of the most demanding war zones.

name: Army Drills
description: For far too long, the warlords of Sichuan were content with their forces resembling bandits more than actual soldiers. To mark a clear break from this past, the Chongqing high command is preparing for a program of province-wide army drilling and retraining. With enough effort, we'll have soldiers that are the most disciplined in all of China!

name: The Mighty Navy
description: Our capital of Chongqing rests near the Yangtze river, leaving it rather vulnerable to naval attacks from downriver, but also making it into a perfect base for the future navy of Sichuan. Eventually, a mighty armada of ships shall patrol the rivers, protecting our trade and people from banditry and showing our might to the rest of China.

name: The Mighty Air Force
description: Why should we scale the mountains of Sichuan to meet every threat when planes can simply attack them from the air? We'll start by importing foreign technology to use as a base. Once we're done, our air force will be the greatest in all of China, able to protect our skies and strike any foe!

name: Adopt Radio Communications
description: Modern wars are increasingly fought with the help of radio, radar and computing machines. It's therefore crucial for our modernisation program that we procure and develop new advances in these fields and that our forces, down to every company, receive training in their use.

name: Dedicated Logistics Units
description: Even after our army becomes the mightiest in China - at least on paper - it'll be helpless in the field without a steady stream of supplies to keep it marching forward. By utilising Chongqing's industry, we'll set up specialised supply trains that will be the envy of all Chinese military planners!

name: Large Front Operations
description: The key to winning battles is to properly utilise the vast manpower of Sichuan to wear down and overwhelm our foes. While a common warlord would simply use them as a bludgeon, we'll develop sophisticated methods for using large infantry charges as our spearheads, including the management and rapid deployment of reserves.

name: Reverse-Engineer Modern Weapons
description: It'd be a waste to simply distribute the foreign equipment we have acquired to the troops. To make the most of it, we'll dispatch our brightest military engineers to reverse-engineer them so that we can produce our own, superior variants.

name: Heavy Firepower Tactics
description: It's clear that we need to double our efforts to produce qualified artillery officers, since many of them still use their batteries in the most rudimentary ways. When we're done reforming our training methods, our artillery will shake the earth itself with mighty barrages ahead of every offensive we launch!

name: Armament Production Innovations
description: We cannot call our army truly modernised unless we develop our own modern arms. We'll pour more funds into our military R&D department so that they have the means to produce new weapons, made from the ground up by Chinese hands.

name: The Industrial Army
description: All our efforts to modernise have borne fruit. Our now mighty army has perfected the fusion of both military and industrial might to overwhelm any foe. Thanks to our industries, we can amass more guns, bullets, bombs and shells to use against our foes than anyone else in China. Let them tremble before the might of the Industrial Army!

name: A Response to Black Monday
description: The economic crisis threatens to tear the Union apart. We must reform our country's economy to solve mass unemployment, but the Volksraad stands divided on the path to take forwards. This choice will certainly have repercussions in the years to come, and may even exacerbate existing divides.

name: Repeal the Industrial Conciliation Act
description: The Industrial Conciliation Act was a direct reaction to the Rand Rebellion in 1922 and gave white trade unions privileges that are slowing economic recovery. The Act must be repealed, and the unions must be brought to heel if we are to get the nation’s economy back on track. This will obviously be extremely unpopular with white workers.

name: Attract Canadian Investment
description: By encouraging Canadian investment, we will give our economy the influx of capital that it desperately needs while also hopefully providing thousands of jobs to our struggling workforce.

name: Opportunities for the Unemployed
description: Be it through the use of bailouts or investment, slowly but surely the amount of jobs in South Africa is climbing out of its lowest point. As more and more people have a job again, they can also spend a bit again, which goes to the benefit of other sectors in the economy.

name: The Witwatersrand Roars Again!
description: The mineral wealth in the Witwatersrand has been a commercial safety net during the economic crisis. While it has been hurt as much as any other part of the South African economy by this crisis, it is clearly starting to reach pre-crisis levels again, pushing our economy to recovery with it.

name: Establish Work Programs
description: A series of work programs for the unemployed is a safe bet for economic recovery and consequently has general support in the party with exception to the hardline unionists within the SAP.

name: Farmer Bail Out
description: The ongoing crisis is a time of suffering for all people of South Africa, but the heaviest burden is without a doubt being carried by our farmers. Rock-bottom prices are necessitating bail outs for both internal producers and exporters aimed at saving our agricultural sector from collapse.

name: Complete the Recovery
description: Finally, we are able to put Black Monday behind us once and for all. Let us move forward into an era of strength for the South African economy!

name: Found the SABC
description: Radio broadcasters have been active in South Africa since 1923, but South Africa has so far lacked a national radio network. As such, voices have risen in Pretoria to officially establish a 'South African Broadcasting Corporation', or, in Afrikaans, 'Suid-Afrikaanse Uitsaaikorporasie', which will broadcast two radio services: one in English, and one in Afrikaans.

name: Fund Stellenbosch University
description: The 'Universiteit Stellenbosch' or the 'Stellenbosch University' is, together with the University of Cape Town, the oldest extant university in sub-Saharan Africa. The university, which is certainly the most high profile of the nation, almost exclusively teaches in Afrikaans, and serves as somewhat of an intellectual hub for the National Party. Investing in them will increase our research capability.

name: Fund the University of the Witwatersrand
description: While not quite as classic as the Cape Town and Stellenbosch Universities, the University of Witwatersrand, founded by J.H. Hofmeyr, is certainly innovative. The university is multi-racial and as such (and through its founder), closely associated with the South African Party.

name: Form the Mathematical Society
description: The South African Mathematical Society is a group of South African intellectuals, who, contrary to the name of the society, deal not only in mathematics but also physics and other such endeavours.

name: Focus on Agricultural Expansion
description: Our history is rooted in the exploits of the farmers who came to South Africa. It would be foolish to throw our cash into the pockets of the already rich English capitalists, who are ever hungry for workers to exploit, those workers being the Africans when the Afrikaners become too expensive. Agriculture is the strength of our nation and the root of our culture.

name: Subsidised Farming
description: One way to support our hard-working farmers is to hand out subsidies, allowing them to perhaps expand their lands a bit, take better precautions against wildlife aiming to attack their livestock, and investing in new machinery.

name: Support Cape Wineries
description: The Mediterranean climate of the Cape is perfect for the cultivation of wine grapes, and as such, South African wine is world-renowned. We should make use of this export boom, and support our wineries in their endeavours.

name: Encourage Sharecropping
description: Sharecropping holds that a landowner allows a tenant to farm on his land in return for a part of the produce. Many Afrikaner farmers are unable to work all of their stretched land of our outstretched nation. It would be economically responsible to encourage them to allow sharecroppers to work this excess land.

name: Agricultural Innovation
description: South Africa is a western nation, but also a nation of agriculture. It is only natural that we have been developing a significant edge on agricultural technology compared to other countries, and we can leverage this innovativeness into other fields of Research and Development.

name: Aid Small Farming Communities
description: When crisis strikes, small farming communities who are unable to offset their goods are often the first victims. It is our responsibility as a government to protect these vulnerable farmers, and we could do that by subsidising their endeavours.

name: Industrial Farming Equipment
description: The Industrial revolution did not only revolutionise industrial efforts but also revolutionised agriculture. We have the means, so we could definitely increase our agricultural efficiency by investing in this kind of machinery.

name: The Granary of Africa
description: Our agricultural achievements have not gone without notice: South African bread is exported through the continent and beyond, feeding colonist and colonial alike. As such, South Africa is quickly becoming known as the Granary of Africa.

name: South Africa's Gold
description: South Africa has significant gold reserves. The presence of gold means we have the means to back up our currency and it's something other countries desire for a similar goal. It would be foolish not to exploit the money that lies below our soil.

name: Focus on Industrial Expansion
description: In the late 19th century, the industrial revolution has truly taken root in South Africa. The combination of natural resources and manpower to work the factories sets South Africa up perfectly to become an industrial powerhouse, while the rest of the continent still digs through the dirt!

name: Appoint Van der Bijl as Director-General
description: Hendrik van der Bijl, the founder of numerous companies, like the Eskom, our electricity company, and the Iron and Steel Corporation of South Africa (ISCOR), is perfectly suited to make our industrial base ready for wartime production needs.

name: Form the IDC of South Africa
description: The Industrial Development Corporation of South Africa will become a financial institution aiding South Africa's industrial development through the distribution of grants to build certain required industries and contribute to our economic growth, allowing our industry to grow.

name: Recruit Native Labour
description: While the Afrikaners and white labourers may resent the encroachment of natives on our industrial zones, the reality is that the white labour pool is simply too small to optimally use the industrial potential of South Africa. With the entire workforce available, we are well on our way to become one of the foremost industrial nations of the world.

name: The Great Repairshop
description: Our industry has rapidly evolved over the last years to enable us to properly support a long-term war effort. This has been so successful that by now, South Africa is known as the 'Great Repairshop', where our allies' equipment in North Africa, the Middle East and Southern Europe goes when it needs repairing.

name: Support ISCOR Expansion
description: The Iron and Steel Corporation of South Africa (ISCOR) has for years been a commercially successful steel corporation. By allowing them to expand their operations, we may expect our steel output to rise markedly.

name: Vanderbijlpark's Steelworks
description: Demand for steel is ever increasing. In light of this fact, Director-General Van der Bijl has overseen an ISCOR acquisition of some 100 square kilometres to build a large new steel plant and a model town surrounding it, living off the steel plant in their vicinity. Reportedly, Van der Bijl himself intends to live in the town he is founding.

name: Industrial Innovation
description: South Africa's industry is rapidly expanding and in its wake comes opportunity and innovation. We can make use of this phenomenon to increase our Research and Development to so far unseen heights!

name: Post-War Boom
description: The war that encompassed the world has destroyed much of the world, but South Africa was mostly spared. It is only natural then, that the rest of the world is looking towards South Africa for its goods. Exports are booming, and because of this, so is South Africa.

name: Procure New Rifle Contracts
description: The state of the South African Army armoury is an embarrassment to say the less, with soldiers still using rifles their grandfathers used in the Great War - or worse, what their great grandfathers used in the Boer War. We must secure new rifles to amend this.

name: Reform Engineer Corps
description: What was learnt in the Great War was the need for Engineers, men who would remove obstacles and provide much-needed repairs to local infrastructure in order to assist in battlefield logistics. With this in mind, reformation of the Engineer Corps is much needed.

name: Reform Ordnance Corps
description: The South African Ordnance Corps was established in 1923 to assist in the supply and maintenance of all technical stores and equipment, which includes guns and ammunition. Since the end of the Great War, the Corps has seen better days, which must be rectified.

name: Establish Defence Headquarters
description: Currently there isn't any real centralisation of the South African Army Command, with provisional bases scattered within their respective provinces. Jan Smuts in a controversial move has moved to establish a Headquarters within Pretoria. This has seen by many as a way of him eroding the provisional commands and militias, though most see the merit in a centralised command network.

name: Expand the Permanent Force
description: The South African Permanent Force consist of full-time volunteers and other auxiliary units that forms a part of the South African Army. With Jan Smuts' move to centralise the command structure of the South African Army, it appears others in a counter move are now wishing to expand the umbrella of the South African Permanent Force by expanding the militias.

name: Jan Smuts' Reforms
description: Jan Smuts' reforms are simple enough in theory, though complex in practice. Jan wishes to centralise the Army further to ensure a fluid command and control is in place. Other reforms also include the allowance of non-white into the military, including combat roles. This has caused an uproar in many parts of country and Jan will have to proceed carefully if he doesn't wish to upset the apple-cart too much.

name: Expand the Cape Corps
description: The Cape Corps is the first 'coloured' unit to be formed in South Africa, having its history stretch all the way back to 1781 with the 'Corps Bastaard Hottentoten' - Corps of Bastards Hottentot. More serving in a non combatant roles, Jan Smuts wishes to expand their roles to include front line infantry and to be included into other branches of the military.

name: Increase the Soldier's Stipends
description: Joining the Army in South Africa has been quite undesirable, with the main grievance being the low pay. As part of Smuts' reforms, the common soldier's stipends will be risen generously to attract more to join.

name: Form Native and Indian Auxiliaries
description: For South Africa to step forward in these troublesome times, they must do so together in unison. Jan Smuts is more pragmatic in his approach, knowing that the South Africa needs men, regardless of their colour or creed, and has looked to increase the enlistment of Native and Indian recruits regardless of the backlash.

name: A Call for Recruits
description: With pay increased and conditions improving, a call to all proud and able men of South Africa has been put out to bolster the numbers of the South African Armed Forces.

name: Casualty Minimisation
description: South Africa has a limited manpower pool to draw from regardless, which in part is self-inflicted. However, the advancement of modern medicine and the treatment of battlefield trauma has allowed for Smut to push for schemes to ensure that men are patched up and returned back to service.

name: Form the SAAC
description: The South African Armoured Corps history begun during the Great War with South African tanks being used in German South West Africa. They proved effective in their engagements, though the vehicles were cumbersome to use. With the advances in Entente tank technology has reduced the latter tenfold, allowing for quick and effective fire support to coincide with infantry support.

name: Modified Tank Designs
description: Necessity is the mother of invention, with current tank designs unable to cope with the unforgiving terrain that South African landscape offers. What begun with our Engineers jury-rigging modifications, has expanded into a program of modifying tanks before they come into service. This does come with an increased production time, however.

name: Savannah Logistics
description: As the saying goes 'An army marches on its stomach' with Napoleon Bonaparte understanding the need for well established supply lines. Measures must be taken to ensure that every South African soldier is well supplied with his rifle in one hand and bolting in the other.

name: Environment-Adjusted Forces
description: The South African Army must be able to face whatever adversary is thrown at it. Whether it be a hail of bullets or the bush in the thick savannah our boys will not be found wanting.

name: South African Army Renewed
description: For better or for worst, the South African Army has reformed into a more efficient fighting force ready to take on the challenges of tomorrow that this turbulent world will bring. Union is Strength - Eendrag Maak Mag.

name: Establish the Coast Defence Corps
description: With South Africa having several ports that are deemed vital for both trade and supply, the establishment of the Coast Defence Corps has been approved. It's goal is to free up manpower by having those not suitable for front-line duty to be stationed at the ports.

name: Modern Artillery Requestion
description: The South African Army currently has artillery pieces that would better be displayed in a war museum opposed to a modern battlefield. A requestion contract has been put forward with the army to decide who they will receive new designs and supplies from.

name: South African Military College
description: With the expansion of the South African military to now include an air force and a navy, it's only natural that these services are provided a place to train the next military minds of the South African armed forces. The college grounds is an expansion of the old Dutch East India Company 'Militere Kweekskool' located in Pretoria, where it helps develop local cadets.

name: Form the Directorate of Supplies
description: The Directorate of Supplies has been established with lessons learned from the Weltkrieg, to ensure that South African forces are self-sufficient until supply lines are established.

name: Establish the Reconnaissance Commando
description: With the motto of 'Through Stealth Our Strength' our newly formed paratroopers will drop behind the enemy lines and wreak havoc there.

name: Oswald Pirow's Five Year Plan
description: Though General Pierre van Reyneveld is the true mastermind of this military reform, it bears the name of Oswald Pirow simply because he has put it forward. It calls for the South African defence policy to follow several new guidelines, but is against the idea of arming the natives.

name: Expand the Special Service Battalion
description: The objective of the Special Service Battalion was to train the youth of our generation in the wake of the effects of Black Monday. This plan wishes to see this expanded to ensure that youths at a younger age are given basic military training to ensure they are ready to fight.

name: Lessons of the Past
description: The Boer wars and the Weltkrieg has taught South Africa several things regarding the art of war. The foremost lesson is that the Kommando tactics of hit and run are still a sound means of warfare. Now with the advancement of motorised warfare, we will allow the South African armed forces to capitalise on these tactics.

name: Reactivate the Kommandos
description: The Kommando units never really officially disbanded, with most just becoming "shooting clubs" or joining the Active Citizen Force, where they would gather and hone their skills. In this initiative, Pirow wishes to activate these units again into a more formal military force, though this will prove to be difficult...

name: Mobility Focused Units
description: Wishing to move away from the horrors of attrition warfare, van Reyneveld seeks to promote the cult of speed within the armed forces, with leg infantry to be motorised and to avoid protracted engagements.

name: Mechanise the Army
description: Motorisation of the armed forces has been slow, but an inherent problem on relying on thin skinned vehicles is the lack of protection they provide. To overcome this, the repurposing of older tanks to carry our troops into the front.

name: Harry the Enemy
description: The enemy must be harried relentlessly, with concentrated attacks designed to draw out the enemy in one location for our forces to strike at another. This was a proven tactic used by the Boer kommandos and further refined by our armed forces.

name: Expand the Branches
description: With reforms occurring within the South African Army, the other branches of the South African Armed Forces must also be expanded and reformed to support and keep up with the challenges the modern day battlefield will bring.

name: Amalgamate the Naval Services
description: Currently there isn't a true South African Navy, with several branches/services performing duties akin to that of a Navy, though in a localised area. These branches/services must be amalgamated into one service, allowing for a true South African Navy to be formed.

name: Expand the South African Pilot Program
description: The South African Air Force is in desperate need of airmen and most of all pilots, if it is to expand to provide the services it's required for.

name: Foreign Expertise
description: South Africa's aviation and naval developments are rudimentary at best, with a real lack of investment made into these branches till now.

name: Canadian Advisors
description: With London being strangled by the tentacles of syndicalism, Ottawa has picked up the torch to lead the Entente into the heart of the red beast. The South African Government has opened its doors to Canadian Advisors, to expand its Air Force and fledging Navy, with the goal of supporting Canada in the great crusade against the syndicalists. Though the Afrikaners aren't impressed with this notion...

name: The 'Imperial Gift'
description: Dubbed the \"Imperial Gift\" by South African Air Force personnel, Canada is providing us a more than modest contribution to our lacklustre air force, in the form of several squadrons worth of aeroplanes, along with parts and munitions.

name: Support South African Aviation Industry
description: Though Canada is more than able to supply South Africa, the perils of war mean that this may not always be a contributing factor. South Africa must be able to provide a small level of dependence with parts and munitions for their Air Force.

name: Entente Pilot Training
description: With new planes, comes new tactics. Entente Advisors have greatly assisted our Pilots in long range patrols of the Cape and introduced the use of Naval Bombers.

name: Royal South African Air Force Reformed
description: The South African Air Force before the support from Canada and other Entente forces was nothing more than a few biplanes from a forgotten era and some "acquired" German Junkers. Now with the latest training and aircraft, the now dubbed Royal South African Air Force, is ready to cry havoc and let slip.

name: Hallifax at the Helm
description: Hallifax, once a retired Admiral of the British fleet has now been requested to take the helm in the reforms required for South Africa to establish its own navy.

name: Wolwe van die See
description: South Africa will never have a large Navy nor will it sport massive battleships or aircraft carriers. With this in mind, developments in the submarines that have been dubbed by Afrikaner naval officers as "Wolwe van die See" - Wolves of the Sea - have shown great prospects and those all too keen Afrikaner naval officers are happy to adopt.

name: Merchant Fleet
description: With the Entente nations contacted via a vast array of overlapping trade routes, the need for a merchant fleet is needed more than ever.

name: South African Navy Formed
description: With Hallifax at the helm, the South African naval branches and been centralised allowing for South Africa to officially have a navy. Though smaller, its main goals are to protect shipping lanes within the Cape and provide limited support to the Canadian war effort.

name: Canadian Naval Development
description: Several of our ports and docks have seen better days, with many not having been in service since the Weltkrieg. With Canadian investment and 'know how', we have begun to overhaul these docks to better assist our Entente allies.

name: Expanding South Africa's Aerodromes
description: With new aeroplanes, comes the need to expand South African aerodromes and lay the ground work for several more.

name: Our Part in the Great Crusade
description: The idea of South African servicemen, fighting and dying for a 'British' cause has never been a popular sentiment in South Africa, but what has become popular is the need to stop the syndicalist threat before it can completely reach our shores.

name: Seeking Help Elsewhere
description: Canada and the Entente are nothing but self serving dullards, who would only drag South Africa into their wars with nothing to give in return. Pirow's recent overtures to the Germans have allowed South Africa to seek help elsewhere regarding the expansion and reforming of our air and naval branches. This hasn't proven popular amongst the Anglo population, however.

name: Dutch Connection
description: Through some extraordinary use of back channels and "meetings", Pirow has been in contact with several Dutch aviation experts, who will assist South Africa in reforming its Air Force, with further talks looking promising regarding the purchasing of Dutch aircraft.

name: South African Fokker Purchase
description: South African has been able to obtain several Dutch-designed Fokker fighters via its new connections. Though limited in numbers, the licence for these aircraft have been secured, though through what means are best left unsaid.

name: SAF_Dutch_Training
description: From our contacts in Mittelafrika, we have been able to obtain "Flüssigkeitsbrandbombe", Liquid Fire Bomb. It contains White Phosphorus, which is effective against enemies who think the thick dense jungle will save them, though the after effects of the weapon are less than desired...

name: Reform the SALM
description: The South African Air Force is now referred by its Afrikaans name of "Suid-Afrikaanse Lugmag", or SALM. It is now a force to be reckoned with. With the next batch of South African pilots now taking to the skies of the savannah, the SALM is ready to face the challenges that loom over the horizon.

name: German Investment
description: SAF_GER_Mil_Invest

name: German Funkmessgerät Installations
description: South Africa is to become Germany's most southern listening post. These installations will better monitor Naval and Air traffic in the Cape and also provide South Africa with a level of early warning needed for its forces to react to a potential threat.

name: Kaiserliche Marine Advisors
description: Pirow didn't sit on idle hands during his fact finding mission to Germany. He was able to obtain the assistance of several Kaiserliche officers, though their reasons for discharge from the Kaiserliche isn't best mentioned...

name: Lessons from Jutland
description: The Second Battle of Jutland for the Kaiserliche showed that being on the bleeding edge of technology is a must. With this in mind, South Africa must have the mindset of "Quality of Quantity" in the construction of its Navy.

name: German Naval Designs
description: German Ship designs have become the world standard, with this in mind, South Africa has been able to secure several new designs for local use.

name: Suid-Afrikaanse Vloot
description: Taking a page from the South African Air Force 'Rebranding' the use of Afrikaans over English for the naming of the newly formed Navy. This action has been taken to move it away from its \"English\" beginnings.

name: South African War Policy?
description: With the both Air and Naval branches of the South African Armed forces receiving the much needed reforms they needed, it's time for South Africa to decide on whether it will defend its own shores or support those in Europe.

name: South Africa's Red Scare
description: Though a \"European\" war is never popular in South Africa, it's a harsh reality that if syndicalism were to prevail in Europe, then in Africa, South Africa would surely be next. We must assist in slaying the Red Beast, before its tentacles make it to our shores...

name: Preserve the Monarchy
description: The Flemish may have kicked us out but the rule of Adelbert shall continue in the south.

name: Consolidate Royal Power
description: Once again it has been proven that only through harsh actions the population can be kept under control.

name: Form Royal Guard
description: We can't keep depending on the Feldgendarmerie, we need a strong and loyal royal guard.

name: Strengthen German Ties
description: Good relations with Berlin are vital for our reign as without them all may collapse once more.

name: Appoint a Royal Councillor
description: The Royal Councillor is our direct link to Parliament which he observes and intervenes in on our behalf. While [GetHeadOfGovernment] has served us well in the past few years, the recent uprisings may have caused the end of his career.

name: Adapt the Constitution
description: The political systems of our nation have changed drastically and a revision of the old Flanders-Walloon constitution is in order.

name: Give Up Our Belgian Claims
description: We should no longer strive for the conquest of Flanders. We are stronger on our own and can better focus on the needs of the Walloon people without them.

name: Liberals Strengthen Control
description: After their victory in the election and the use of their coalition to maneuvre them into an ideal position, they can finally focus on strengthening their own control over the total picture.

name: Le Chant des Wallons
description: Nationalism has been reinforced, the nation strengthened and new opportunities appear at every corner. Guided by our national anthem and the will of our people will we march towards the horizon!

name: Reaffirm Belgian Claims
description: The Flemish may have gotten the best of us during their revolution but the lion has been licking its wounds under the guise of a rooster. Soon we shall strike and take back our rightful land.

name: War Games on the Flemish Border
description: The Flemish invasion is imminent and close observation and training along the border may provide us with the edge we need.

name: Lobby Abroad
description: After their independence they were able to escape our wrath under the wing of Germany. We need to prove to Wilhelm that we are capable of holding the region and that splitting it up is detrimental to his greater vision.

name: Send the Ultimatum
description: The time for war has come. Flanders will bow beneath the rooster and will rejoin our union.

name: Reform into a Republic
description: The monarchy has proven to be a failure and has been replaced by the Walloon Republic

name: Hold Elections
description: With tensions high between the POB, PL and German royalists, elections have to be held as soon as possible to bring stability back to our nation.

name: Invite the Catholics
description: To secure a total majority in Parliament and consolidate our power base, we'll need the support from the Catholics in the south.

name: Invite the Socialists
description: We have to extend the olive branch to our friends in the POB to guide the way towards a stable and prosperous society.

name: Form a Government
description: The first round of negotiations has proven successful and it's now time to finalise the formation and announce the new Walloon government.

name: Syndicalist Revolution
description: The syndicalist revolution has arrived and is sweeping through the industrial centres of the Sillon Industriel. A steady hand will be necessary to avoid bloodshed and violence.

name: Peaceful Transition
description: The only way to truly win over the heart of the working class is by fair and democratic elections. Through a solid parliamentary powerbase, we'll start reforming and shaping Wallonia into our socialist ideal.

name: A POB President
description: Fernand Dehousse has led the party through the elections and should be the undisputed leader of the party. As the first Walloon president, he will guide Wallonia towards the future.

name: A Syndicalist Chairman
description: Fernand Dehousse has grown soft and has abandoned all what the Syndicalist revolution stood for. He will need to be replaced by a true syndicalist so the revolution can continue.

name: Nationalise the Basic Industry
description: The Steel and Coal industry is our most important industrial branch but is nearly entirely controlled by Walloon and German capitalists. If we were to take control over these important sectors we can secure that workers are placed above profits.

name: Found the National Mining Company
description: To avoid an industrial collapse on the scale of Black Monday, we need to create a state-owned mining company to control and subsidise our own coal mines to secure the jobs of our people.

name: Expand State Education
description: To reduce the influence of the Catholics, we need to prove that state education can be just as good or even better.

name: Abolish Catholic Education
description: Through their vast education system, the Catholics control the mind and spirit of our youth. Church and Education should be completely separated and the latter be made solely state controlled.

name: Introduce Women's Suffrage
description: Some of our voters are starting to doubt whether the POB will stay on the revolutionary path or is starting to drift off into a status quo complacency. Therefore the leader of the Party has announced that he will press for voting rights for all citizens : men and women.

name: The POB Retains Control
description: With most large scale reforms passed, the popularity of the POB is reaching new heights prompting a stronger position for the coming elections.

name: Disband the Parliamentary System
description: It has become clear that a Syndicalist Revolution is the only way forward for Wallonia and therefore the POB has pushed for the complete abolition of the parliamentary structure, with it to be replaced with a syndicalist system based on our French neighbour.

name: Declare the Walloon Commune
description: The time has come for the workers to rise up and break the chains. The Walloon Commune will be declared ushering in a new era!

name: Join the Internationale
description: With ties between Wallonia and Germany completely collapsing, we need the support of our brethren in France to secure the continuation of the revolution.

name: Revolution By Force
description: It's clear that the workers need to be shaken out of their oppression and united by a strong leader.

name: Seize Royal Assets
description: The Royal Treasure has steadily been filled with the gains of our sweat. It is only right that those assets are returned to the working man at once.

name: Combat Military Disorder
description: With large disagreements erupting in the army between the German royalists and democratic supporters, we need a large scale cleanup of these resisting elements to restore order.

name: Fight the Establishment
description: The ruling class has been growing rich on the back of our work and will now have to pay for their treason.

name: Defeat Loyalist Remnants
description: Funded by Walloon and German capitalists, resisting cells of the former army have dug themselves in across the nation to resist to the last man against the Revolution.

name: Seize German Companies
description: The German companies have infested the Sillon Industriel and abused our population to finance the German Empire. No more!

name: Unite the POB
description: The POB is still divided due to moderate elements in the party. These will have to be eliminated or 'persuaded' to join our cause.

name: Hold the First Party Congress
description: The Revolution is in full sway and to announce their plans for the coming years, the POB leadership has announced the First Party Congress. Experts and important figures from the Commune of France, the Union of Britain and Italy have all been invited.

name: The Government Has Failed
description: The pathetic excuse of a government has finally been overthrown and has been replaced by a strong and centralised government surrounding Degrelle.

name: Control Parliament
description: The power of the parliament should be severely cut back as its constant meddling with government affairs has proven detrimental to our stability.

name: Replace Our Ambassador to Germany
description: To further outline our change in policy, the ambassador to Germany will be recalled and replaced by a close friend of Degrelle.

name: The Revolution Has Failed
description: The syndicalist revolution was a disgraceful ruse to trick the population in becoming slaves of the evil POB leadership. They should be happy that we are 'liberating' them from their own ambitions.

name: Imprison Syndicalist Leadership
description: We can't have syndicalist preachers rallying the populace of the sillon industriel. Therefore all leading members of the syndicalist resistance are to be tracked down and 'taken care' of.

name: Introduce Corporatsism
description: It has become clear that traditional capitalism is a failure which should be replaced by a better economic model.

name: Military Propaganda
description: A weak army led to our defeat in the Weltkrieg. No more! With rejuvenated enthusiasm and a widespread propaganda campaign, our army will be the pride of the low countries.

name: Demand our Rightful Land
description: We won't settle for the humiliation imposed on us by the Germans and Flemish. All of Belgium belongs to Degrelle!

name: Walloon Expansion
description: The lands of Wallonia abound with unharnessed potential. Let the land finally be put to work for those who labour on them. We should develop the basis of a new economic plan under which our economy can stand upon its own two feet.

name: The Sillon Industriel
description: The Sillon Industriel is the industrial heartland of Wallonia, it's output unparalleled. However, the region saw a number of strikes under the Flandro-Walloon administration which disrupted production and destabilised the nation. It is pertinant therefore that we placate the people and industrial centres of the region with even more pronounced state support.

name: Direction of the Industry
description: Wallonia was the beating heart of Belgian industry. It cannot be denied that the fate of the forges and factories are intimately linked with that of the entire nation. Our industrial aparatus must be comprehensively assessed in order to facilitate its expansion.

name: Double Down on Heavy Industry
description: While our economy has evolved with the times, heavy industry has remained its foundation. We should further industrialise our nation, offering generous incentives for the development of new industrial zones in the nation's middling cities.

name: Redefine Walloon Expertise
description: Wallonia has long been one of Europe's foremost industrial regions, and our people possess skills relevant to such an economy. The winds of change blow strongly however, and we must adapt. To begin with, we should offer increased funding to the cutting-edge Solvay Research Institute.

name: Future Resource Extraction
description: The natural wealth of Wallonia was critical to its industrialisation. New extraction methods allow both long-exploited resources and those whose economic relevancy is yet emerging to be more effectively extracted. We must keep our ear to the ground and offer support to industries dealing with resource extraction for experimental ventures.

name: Breakthrough in Engineering
description: New methods of building construction and optimisation allow industry to be more productive while consuming fewer resources. We should sponsor the redevelopment of older industrial facilities to take advantage oof these modern engineering techniques.

name: Aviation Industry
description: Our nation cannot rely even on our closest of allies to supply sufficient aeroplanes in times of war. To have peace of mind at last, we must fund the construction of new state aircraft factories.

name: Build Our Own Cyclotron
description: Cyclotrons have been the primary means by which a plethora of new discoveries in the field of partical physics have come about. While expensive, with sufficient government funding, our nation can create a cyclotron of its own.

name: Expand Seraing Steel Mills
description: The city of Seraing, while not extremely populace and often overlooked, has become an important centre of industry, particularly steel production. We should offer state support for the city's steel mills and work to turn them into the envy of the world.

name: Build the Liege-Charleroi Highway
description: Roadways between the industrial centres of Liege and Charleroi are woefully insufficient. We should build a long-proposed central motorway between them.

name: Fund the University of Liège
description: Liège has been a centre of learning since the middle ages, and today the city's primary university is perhaps our nation's most prestigious institution of higher learning. With further funding and integration of the institution into our military research and development system, our nation as a whole can further benefit.

name: German Investments
description: Our nation's connection to Germany has not only survived but continues to strengthen. Surely German investment is key to ensuring not only the end of our economic woes, but sustained growth into the distant future.

name: Increase German Exports
description: Given our present political situation, German markets are more important to our national economy than ever. we should work with the Germans to decrease mutual barriers to trade and subsidise businesses which primarily export to Germany.

name: Krupp Wallonia
description: The Krupp company's expertise in steel production has already a boon. With state support, Krupp can surely lead our steel industry into a golden age of productivity.

name: Encourage Frontaliers
description: Many of our people work abroad in the nations of Mitteleuropa and send remitances home. This represents a sizeable portion of our national economy, and while it hurts our industrial centres to some extent by shrinking the labour market, the increased disposable income this reality brings is surely economically beneficial.
